info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:33PM EDT until July 31 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues, mostly on Gunpowder Falls at Glencoe and Beaverdam Run at Cockeysville.
* WHERE...A portion of northern Maryland, including the following county, Baltimore.
* WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cockeysville... Phoenix... Sparks... Glencoe... Hunt Valley... Monkton... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... York Road at Beaverdam Run near Beaver Run Lane, Beaver Dam Road at Beaverdam Run near Cockeysville, Phoenix Road at Gunpowder Falls near Carroll Road and Lower Glencoe Road at Gunpowder Falls near Glencoe. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING
